results.title: Begone dull care
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren, Evelyn Lambart and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A lively interpretation of jazz music played by the Oscar Peterson Trio. The music is visually represented in a series of abstract lines and shapes, hand painted directly on to the film, culminating in a fast and furious explosion as the tempo quickens. One of the high points of jazz in cinema (and of McLaren’s career).

results.title: Beginnings...
results.brief_description: Eugenia feels she is defined by her relationship to others. Here she explores her relationship to herself and asks the question “what do I mean to me?”

results.title: Beginnings of vertebrate life
results.creator_credit: William Kay and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Reveals complex processes by which a one-celled egg, becomes a many-celled, highly organized individual. Shows by means of time-lapse photography and animation the embryonic development of a small fresh water fish, Oryzias latipes, illustrating early processes of fertilization, cell division and formation of the blastula.

results.title: Beginnings of conscience
results.brief_description: A driver obeys traffic signs even when there is no one in sight because he has a conscience, instilled since childhood by his daily life at home, school, and work. The socialization process is analysed in terms of the life of an “average” boy. Shows influence of parental approval or disapproval, peer acceptance or rejection, and forms of discipline in various social situations. In a nutshell, this film implores the “educational aspect of punishment.” It explains that without socialisation, and without the sanctions used to achieve it, there would be no basis for moral order in human society.

results.title: Beginnings - Inspiration - the Role of the Writer
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Writers on Writing”.
This series is based on a growing archive of video material of conversations between contemporary writers discussing their work. The material has been re-edited to form a resource for students and teachers of English, and each of the six twenty-minute videos focuses on different aspects and stages of the writing process. Each video is accompanied by a resource booklet. In this video, writers talk about how they began to write, what their inspiration is and their perception of the writer’s role.

results.title: Beginnings
results.creator_credit: Lina Gagnon, Suzanne Gervais, Clorinda Warny, Gason Sarault and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This film describes the animator’s personal view of the universe. Abstract landscapes evolve into strange, god-like figures whose images revert into landscapes. The movements are slow and dreamy. The product of an eclectic imagination, this universe draws on historical, literary, and classical sources to illustrate man’s close ties with nature. Awards: Eight including Ottawa; New York; Columbus; London; Los Angeles; Annecy.

results.title: Beginning wheel techniques
results.brief_description: An introduction to the fundamentals of pottery. Wheel throwing is simplified by using the clock dial as a means of reference. Techniques shown making a cylinder are sticking, mastering, centering, opening, raising and finishing. The potter’s rib is demonstrated. The needle point tool is used to level and to test for centre bottom thickness. Similar techniques are shown for bowl and plate forms.

results.title: Beginning tumbling
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tumbling”.
By regular and slow-motion demonstration, accompanied by a simple explanatory commentary, the following tumbling starts are taught: forward roll, dive to forward roll, three men sideward roll, stand, hand walk, cartwheel, round-off and combinations.

results.title: Beginning swimming
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Jorhal Pictures
results.brief_description: Land and water drills are used in demonstrating basic techniques of swimming for beginners. Includes demonstrations of the crawl stroke, breast stroke, back stroke and back float. Shows how kicking, breathing, floating, paddling, stroking and pulling with the arm are co-ordinated in the American crawl.
